sentences.sContent: Attitudes to mental illness have shifted in recent years.
sentences.sCn: 对精神病的态度近年来已稍微有所改变。

sentences.sContent: ...in the hope that the demographic pool of high-level contenders will eventually begin to shift and become less exclusive...
...Economists project that most employers would shift money from expensive health benefits into wages...
...and refused to let providers shift additional costs to them...
...DuBravac works for CTA--which puts on the show each year--and said that this shift to a search for solutions has been noticeable as he researched his predictions for 2016...
...we are starting to see companies shift from what is the largest screen size...
...Studying at university will only become less attractive if employers shift their focus away from where someone went to university—and there is no sign of that happening anytime soon...
...the shift may reduce the pressure on land...
...there is a definite shift in emphasis towards less tough styles of management – at least in America and Europe...
...the settlement paves the way for a subtle shift in the company's role from provider of information to seller...
...the shift in the centre of gravity to older age groups is bound to have a profound effect on societies...

phrases.pCn: 典范转移；思考模式的转移
相移键控；相位偏移电信

trans.tranOther: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
